title: Useful for quick API testing but lacks advanced features
body: As a QA engineer, I often use Hoppscotch for debugging APIs during development. The interface is clean and easy to set up requests quickly, which helps speed up basic testing workflows. However, I find it lacks advanced features like automated test scripting and detailed response validations, which limits its usefulness in comprehensive test scenarios. Integration with CI pipelines is also minimal, so for running tests in a full QA process, I have to rely on other tools. Overall, it's a decent lightweight option for quick checks but not sufficient for end-to-end API testing needs.

title: Efficient API debugging tool that integrates smoothly
body: Hoppscotch has become my go-to for debugging APIs during backend development. Its straightforward interface lets me quickly construct and send requests without the overhead of heavier tools. I especially appreciate how easily I can save and organize test cases for repeated checks. The real-time response viewer helps identify issues fast, which speeds up our debugging cycles. Given its lightweight nature and reliable performance, it consistently outperforms other similar options I’ve tried. It’s a solid choice for any backend engineer looking to streamline API testing.

title: Good for basic API testing but lacks advanced features
body: I use Insomnia primarily for debugging REST APIs during development. The interface is straightforward, which makes spinning up requests quick and easy. However, when it comes to handling more complex workflows like automated testing or managing large collections with environment variables, it feels limited. The lack of native CI integration means I still rely on other tools for end-to-end testing in our pipelines. Overall, it's decent for quick tests but doesn't fully meet the needs of a senior backend engineer dealing with scalable API debugging and testing.
